page.title: 12A Country Living
page.content: Mr.W.G.Burgess has happy memories of a busy country life in West Stour.He went to the village school where his teacher was Miss Fowles of East Stour until he was old enough to leave the school and work at Highbridge Mill. With the outbreak of the war he went to work at Manor Farm.He became a skilled ditcher and thatcher,up at 5.a.m. and making his own thatching spars at night in the woodhouse. A well in the garden gave good water and he kept a cow.His wife made their butter.He rented ground at the Lynch for pigs and hens.A busy life indeed, but he still found time to enjoy all those happenings which make village life special.He still takes a keen interest in village affairs from his house near the church.
